byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by J. David Goodman, Winnie Hu, Michael D. Regan, Rick Rojas and Nate Schweber, and research by Susan C. Beachy.

abstract: Richard W Matt and David P Sweat, convicted murderers who escaped together from Clinton Correctional Facility in Dannemora, NY, and remain at large, are hardened criminals who have spent little of their adult lives outside of prison; both had troubled childhoods and began life of crime at an early age; met and planned escape while living in 'honor block', section of prison that offers more rights and liberties to inmates with good behavior.
lead_paragraph: Richard W. Matt and David Sweat emerged from curdled childhoods that included early displays of evil behavior, interviews and documents reveal.

headline.main: Broken Boys, Thieves, Killers, and Now Escapees
